Candidate :  Kristina Ma ther   
 
 
PERSONAL DETAILS  
  
Location:   North West  
 
 
QUALIFICATIONS  
 
BEng Chemical Eng ineering – University of Manchester  
Currently studying towards PMP Certification (PMI)  
Nuclear Institute – Introductio n to Commercial in Nuclear (1 -day course)  
Trelleborg Offshore – Sales and Bid Management course (1 week)  
 
Languages:  
Russian  
Englis h 
 
 
CARE ER SUMMARY  
 
Sep 2019 to date CRP Subsea (previously known as Trelleborg Offshore UK )  
Position : Project Manager, Applied Technology & Renewables  
• Managed Class 4 (complex) international engineering a nd manufacturing projects from 
conception to delivery within offshore wind and Oil & Gas industries, (£3 -8m);  
• Worked to tight deadlines in a fast -paced environment, whilst ensuring customer satisfaction 
with a safe, profitable and on -time delivery of pr oducts;  
• Identified and tracked risks within a risk register to provide mitigating actions at an early stage, 
including reducing impact associated with raw material and personnel availability due to COVID -
19 pandemic;  
• Reviewed customer standards and s pecifications to determine scope of work and commercial 
requirements and flow down to subcontractors;  
• Supported sales in the process of winning work by providing estimates, project schedules and 
adding risk specific contingencies to sale price and leadt imes;  
• Managed and coordinated various project teams of up to 20 people from engineering, quality, 
procurement, testing, logistics and operations departments. This included collaboration with 
internal and external teams in the UK and India.  
• Increased profit margins by managing suppliers and brought more revenue to the projects by 
requesting timely variation orders;  
• Tracked and managed change within projects by keeping a change management log and 
aligning resources and budgets to support the change;  
• Produced project specific documentation, including Project Execution Plans, schedules, risk 
registers, change logs, VORs, part lists, manufacturing release documentation and customer 
project reports;  
 • Engaged with stakeholders on a daily business to b uild better relationships, align expectations, 
reduce risks and to prevent any potential disputes;  
• Supported invoicing and revenue recognition process to increase cashflow in line with the 
company’s KPIs.  
 
 
Nov 2015 to Sep 2019  DBD Ltd  
 
April 2019 – September 2019  
Position: Strategy & Planning M anager  
• Analysed project requirements and resource utilisations and drove productivities by finding 
billable opportunities to personnel;  
• Responsible for managing the integration of the PSA software Replicon into the company and 
ensuring successful implementat ion and upgrade of the system;  
• Worked with team leaders and project managers to identify, track and mitigate risks that would 
impact on the company’s core business and projects;  
• Responsible for the PMO compliance with ISO 9001, reviewing and updating  current processes 
and procedures.  
 
Nov 2015 – March 2019  
Position: Project Manager  
Project Management  
• Responsible for the simultaneous overview of the company’s projects in terms of budget, costs, 
resources, deadlines and invoicing ;  
• Managed the successful delivery of delegated contracts for UK and international clients, from 
the bid phase to contract completion;  
• Developed weekly Earned Value reports to monitor progress, cost to complete, budget analysis, 
resource utilisation, upcoming key dates and highlighting any risks and opportunities to the 
business heads;  
• As part of business improvement, developed and introduced various procedures to the 
business, such as Earned Value Analysis, Risk and Opportunities Management, Change  
Management and Small Projects Monitoring, and presented this in the training guide format to 
the company.  
• Managed stakeholders’ expectations through creating trustworthy relationships and positive 
communication. Practiced effective positive communicati on within the project, recognising 
resource pressures from parallel projects and client challenges;  
• Managed the production of WBS, cost estimat

career_advancement: Focus on building core technical skills
Seek mentorship from senior team members
Take on challenging projects to gain experience
